document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

bibRefCitation.author: Park
bibRefCitation.refString: Park, K. T. & Wu, C. S. (1997) Genus Scythropiodes Matsumura in China and Korea (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae), with description of seven new species. Insecta Koreana, 14, 29 - 42.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Scythropiodes barbellatus
Park et Wu, 1997
: 39
. TL:
China
(Jiangxi). TD: IZCAS .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Adult (
Fig. 9
) with wingspan 13.0–15.5 mm.
Scythropiodes barbellatus
is similar to
S. gnophus
in appearance by having a uniformly dark brown forewing with a narrow yellow costal band. It can be separated from the latter in the male genitalia by the valva not being bifurcated distally, the costa having a long leaf-like process at distal 1 / 4 , the transtilla with paired lateral lobes, and the trapezoidal juxta (
Fig. 24
); and in the female genitalia by the absence of a signum (
Fig. 37
). In
S. gnophus
, the valva is bifurcated into two lobes from distal 1 / 4 , the costa lacks a process, the transtilla lacks lateral lobes, and the juxta is inverted triangular in the male genitalia (
Fig. 25
); and the corpus bursae has a pair of pyriform signa in the female genitalia (
Fig. 38
).

Distribution.
China
(Anhui, Chongqing, Fujian, Guangdong, Guangxi, Guizhou, Hainan, Henan, Hubei, Jiangxi, Sichuan, Zhejiang).
Notes. The female of this species is described for the first time.
